action.action-desc: Mr. Fulcher introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To require the Secretary of Health and Human Services to award grants to pregnancy-help organizations.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Pregnancy Center Security Act.
Part P of title III of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 280g et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: The Secretary shall award grants, on a competitive basis, to pregnancy-help organizations.

paragraph.text: A grant awarded under this section shall be used for upgrading the facilities of the pregnancy-help organization receiving such grant, including through—

subparagraph.text: implementing security upgrades, such as by installing security cameras or security systems; or
improvements to comply with requirements under the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, including regulations promulgated under such Act.

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding paragraph (1), no funds from a grant under this section may be—

subparagraph.text: used to perform, assist, counsel, prescribe, refer for, or encourage abortion; or
provided by the pregnancy-help organization to any other entity that performs, assists, counsels, prescribes, refers for, or encourages abortion.

subsection.text: In this section, the term pregnancy-help organization—

paragraph.text: means an organization that seeks to provide a range of services to individuals facing unintended pregnancies, with the intention of encouraging pregnant women to give birth to their unborn children; and
notwithstanding paragraph (1), does not include any organization that—

subparagraph.text: performs, assists, counsels, prescribes, refers for, or encourages abortion; or
affiliates with any organization that performs, assists, counsels, prescribes, refers for, or encourages abortion.

subsection.text: There are authorized to be appropriated such sums as may be necessary to carry out this section.
